No, because the question was about XML and your solu=
tion won't work for 
several reasons:
1. The indention may be different.
2.=
 The sequence of the attributes may be different.
3. The result may have at=
tributes that are allowed but not mandatory.
4. The encoding might be diffe=
rent.

A string compare can only be done on exclusively canonized XML.
